page.title: 11The Salmon Fishers
page.content: There are seventeen licensed salmon fishers allowed to fish the Taw and Torridge estuary. They are governed as to the size of mesh and also the length of their nets. As the tide turns and is on its way in the salmon fishers row small boats away from the shore line. One man stays on shore holding the end of the net and the boatman allows the net to fall from the stern of his small boat. He travels in a U shape and returns to the shore. The net is then hauled slowly and carefully ashore and the fish are trapped. This method is called seine netting. We watched the men fish for about an hour and in that time three boats landed a selection of fish. Flounders, grey mullet, dabs, whiting, sea trout and six salmon, some quite large, made up the catch.
